bill.title: Compressed natural gas; revise manner of taxing that used in motor vehicles.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-59-3, 27-59-7, 27-59-11 And 27-59-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Terms For Purposes Of The State Liquefied Compressed Gas Tax Laws; To Provide For A Privilege Tax On Natural Gas Sold Or Delivered By A Utility To The Owner Of A Private Refueling System Or To A Public Refueling Station For Compression Into Compressed Natural Gas For Use As Fuel In Motor Vehicles; To Provide That A Utility That Sells Or Delivers Natural Gas To The Owner Of A Private Refueling System Or To A Public Refueling Station For Such Purposes Shall Install Or Cause To Be Installed A Separate Meter For The Natural Gas To Be Used By The Private Refueling System Or Public Refueling Station For Such Purposes; To Provide That A Person Desiring To Operate A Private Refueling System Or A Public Refueling Station Must First Obtain A Permit From The Department Of Revenue; To Bring Forward Sections 27-59-9, 27-59-13, 27-59-17, 27-59-23, 27-59-25, 27-59-29, 27-59-31, 27-59-33, 27-59-35, 27-59-41 And 27-59-47, Which Are Sections Of The Liquefied Compressed Gas Tax Laws, For The Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.
